Systems Biology Workbench (SBW)

SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.caltech.sbw
Class DataBlockReader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.DataBlockReader
public final class DataBlockReader
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements low-level API methods for reading the data portion of a message. The data portion is the application-specific content sent by one application to another, and excludes the message wrapper (which is comprised of data about the source of a message, its destination, etc.). The message wrapper is under control of SBW and is handled transparently to applications.

In the SBW Java interface, the message data block is accessible at the application level only in two contexts:

  • As the value returned by SBWLowLevel.call(int, int, int, edu.caltech.sbw.DataBlockWriter). This the synchronous message-sending operation available through the low-level API in SBW.

  • As one of the arguments in the Receiver.receive(int fromModule, int service, int method, DataBlockReader args) method. This is the class and method that a module must supply to send and receive messages if the module is being defined using the low-level API in SBW.
DataBlockReader object contents can only be created by SBW. Applications cannot add content into a DataBlockReader.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Andrew Finney, $Author: mhucka $
See Also:
DataBlockWriter, SBWLowLevel, Receiver

Method Detail

getInt

public int getInt()
           throws SBWTypeMismatchException
Extracts and returns the next element in the message, assuming it is an integer. If the next element is not an integer, this method throws an exception.

Returns:
an integer corresponding to the value of the next element in the message (which is assumed to be an integer)
Throws:
SBWTypeMismatchException - if the next value is not an integer

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject()
                           throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException,
                                  SBWTypeMismatchException
Extracts and returns the next element in the message and return it as an object. The type will be handled appropriately, so that for example, if an integer is the next element, a Integer object will be returned.

Returns:
a object representing the next element in the message
Throws:
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if the next value is not a recognized type
SBWTypeMismatchException - if the type of element within a list or array does not match the expected data type

getIntoCollection

public java.util.Collection getIntoCollection()
                                       throws SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException,
                                              SBWTypeMismatchException
Extracts and returns the entire contents of the rest of this message as a Java Collection. This calls getObject() repeatedly until it reaches the end of the message.

Returns:
a Collection containing the elements in the message
Throws:
SBWTypeMismatchException - if the type of an element does not match the expected data type based on its type code
SBWUnsupportedObjectTypeException - if an object with an unsupported data type is encountered

getNextType

public byte getNextType()
Returns the next byte in the message without actually consuming that byte. This is normally only useful for checking the data type of the next element in the message (hence the name, "getNextType").

Returns:
value of the next byte in the message
